ygData.subject: Re: The bum and the hole...
ygData.msgSnippet: We ll have to think about it. I don t watch enough TF, I guess. Impact you say.. wasn t Branding s weapon a flamethrower? I forgot about the extra weapon fire,

We'll have to think about it. I don't watch enough TF, I guess. 
Impact you say.. wasn't Branding's weapon a flamethrower? I forgot 
about the extra weapon fire, how big is Arty? because Pacifix is 
standing in the entrance to the hideout, if Arty is bigger than 14 
feet, Pacifix isn't in too much danger of being hit by friendly fire, or 
flame. What I'm trying to get at is Arty is acting as a shield for 
Pacifix.  =0


On 31 May 2001, at 15:07, CYBERWOLF4 wrote:

> As for unrealistic, during the gulf war how did american and Saudi
> missles destroy Iraqui Scud missles? as soon as a hissle was fired
> it's warhead would be active, virtually any impact would destroy it.
> (Optimal Optimus would have NEVER been able to deflect Rampages missle
> simply by useing his arm.) But the writers allowed it because it
> allowed them to destroy the Maximal ship so the Maximals wouldn't have
> to defend it and the Ark at the same time, a war on two fronts
> would've weakened the Maximals and since they didn't really have a
> qualified leader for the second front they would've lost the Beast
> Wars.
> 
> If anyone feels I abuse the rules then say so but since it's usually
> my characters that end up looking like the wrong end of a collision
> with a mack truck I personally don't feel I do. Blocking an attack
> should be legal as long as it doesn't end up being EVERY attack. She
> shot down two missles and an attack failed, logical solution- ATTACK
> AGAIN AND SEE WHAT HAPPENS.
> 
> I've already posted that Brandeds flamethrower can heat up like a
> blast furnace, for those of you who haven't worked industry that would
> be anywhere from 2000 to 5000 degrees  (Nothing compared to "Advanced"
> Transformer technology.)  depending on whats being melted (Science
> note for those interested) Brass has a melting point of 1800 degrees,
> copper slightly lower.(Softer metal requires lower temperature.)
> 
> One last question- How is it that Arty and Pacifix are engaged in hand
> to hand combat but Pacifix isn't being hit by any of the weapons fire
> being used against Arty? We've got Slags flames, Artemiss' automatic
> weapons fire, and whatever other attacks come his way. It's three on
> one people, IM each other and get your attacks organized. By all
> rights Arty Should be toast. (Burnt toast if Slag keeps eatin
> Jabernero peppers.)
> 
>  ----- Original Message -----
> From: robertdahl <rdahl@...>
> To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Thursday, May 31, 2001 7:53 AM
> Subject: Re: The bum and the hole...
> 
> 
> > OOC: Well I just need to ad my opinion, I think the rule of
> > interception is pretty useless, and poorly thought out. IMH it is
> > much more interesting sometimes to intercept than to just dodge when
> > you think you dont want to accept dammage. And Jeff, in the show
> > they did intercept, ussually missiles with gun fire, but sometimes
> > more powerful rays against each other. Megatron and Dinobots laser
> > war from Double Dinobot comes to mind. In the original series, Slag
> > even ignited a missile with his flame breath before it reached him,
> > and I'm not sure, but I think Inferno did it too.
> >
